author: World Resources Institute

resources.description: The Aqueduct Water Risk Framework enables users tornstudy indicators individually or collectively, as well asrnto quantify and compare a variety of multidimensionalrnwater-related measures. Indicators are grouped into threerncategories of water risks to business based on definitionsrnprovided by CeresrnrnPhysical Risks: Quantity: Physical risks related tornquantity are defined as the exposure to changes in waterrnquantity (e.g. droughts or floods) that may impact arncompanyu2019s direct operations, supply chains and/or logistics.rnPhysical water risks also refer to the disruptionrnof needed electric power due to water issues becausernmany electricity sources require water for cooling (e.g.rnnuclear or coal plants) or for generation (hydropower).rnrnPhysical Risks: Quality: Physical risks related tornquality are defined as the exposure to changes in waterrnquality that may impact a companyu2019s direct operations,rnsupply chains, and/or logistics.rnrnReputational and Regulatory Risks: Reputationalrnrisks are defined as potential conflicts with the publicrnregarding water issues that can damage a companyu2019srnimage or result in the loss of the companyu2019s licensernto operate in a community. Reputational risks arernparticularly common in developing countries whererninfrastructure and/or regulation may not be sufficientrnto provide all users with access to safe and reliablerndrinking water supplies. Regulatory risks are defined asrnthe exposure to the impacts of water-related regulationsrnon a given company. As physical and reputational pressuresrnincrease, many local and national governmentsrnare responding with more stringent water policies.rnIf unanticipated, these regulatory changes can proverncostly to companies and, in some cases, limit industrialrnactivities in particular geographic areas.
resources.name: Aqueduct Global Water Risk Atlas

title: Aqueduct Global Water Risk Atlas
name: aqueduct-global-water-risk-atlas
notes: Aqueduct's global water risk mapping tool helps companies, investors, governments, and other users understand where and how water risks and opportunities are emerging worldwide.
